query: who holds the record for longest home run
response: Joey Meyer holds the record for the longest home run in professional baseball history, hitting a 582-foot home run while playing for the Triple-A Denver Zephyrs in 1987.[1][2] Babe Ruth's longest home run was 575 feet, but there are no accurate measurements of his mythical home runs beyond 600 feet.[3] Miguel Sanó hit a 495-foot home run, which is the longest measured by Statcast.[4] Reggie Jackson hit the farthest home run in MLB All-Star Game history at 539 feet.[5]

query: become teacher UK
response: To become a teacher in the UK, you must have a degree and gain Qualified Teacher Status (QTS) by following a programme of Initial Teacher Training[1]. Entry requirements include at least a GCSE grade B/5 (or above) or equivalent in English and maths[2], as well as grade 4 (C) or above in GCSE Science for primary school teachers[3]. The University of Kentucky College of Education offers teacher education programs to help prepare individuals to become teachers[4].

query: Is there an advantage to using the Imperial System of measurement instead of the Metric System?
response: The imperial system of measurement has advantages over the metric system, such as being more associated with everyday life.[1]It is also easier to use than the metric system.[2]However, the U.S. has not adopted the metric system due to the time and money it would take to change the country's infrastructure.[3]Therefore, most have accepted a joint unit system, teaching children in school both the imperial system and the metric system.[3]

Whenever the discussion of switching unit systems arose in Congress, the passage of a bill favoring the metric system was thwarted by big businesses and American citizens who didn’t want to go through the time-consuming and expensive hassle of changing the country’s entire infrastructure
In modern times, most have accepted a joint unit system—teaching children in school both the traditionally used IS system and the metric system that most of the rest of the world uses.

query: Should the age of retirement be increased?
response: Most experts agree that the retirement age should be increased, with the full retirement age gradually raised for people born after 1960 to 68, 69 or 70.[1]This would mean smaller Social Security payments for many retirees, but those who delay claiming Social Security after their full retirement age up until age 70 can increase their monthly Social Security payments.[2]Congress mandated these changes in 1983, citing improvements in the health of older people and increases in life expectancy as reasons for raising the retirement age.[3]Adjustments could be made to prevent those who claim earlier from getting even lower benefits.[4]

query: where did the name salt water taffy come from
response: Salt water taffy is said to have received its name after a boardwalk candy shop flooded with water from the Atlantic Ocean in 1883, soaking all the taffy in salty seawater. Reportedly, the shop owner joked with a customer that all he had was salt water taffy, and the name stuck.[1] However, some people think Salt Water Taffy is really made from a process using sea water, hence the name “Salt Water Taffy”.[2] Most food historians believe salt water taffy was invented in the early 1880s by John Ross Edmiston.[3][4][5]

query: why do we know so little about the ocean, but know so much about the moon?
response: The reason we know so little about the ocean compared to the moon is largely technological. While we have been able to explore the moon in detail using robotic spacecraft and human missions, exploring the deep ocean poses many technical challenges. The extreme pressure, darkness, and vastness of the ocean floor make it difficult to explore and study. In addition, the ocean covers over 70 percent of the Earth's surface, and much of it is remote and difficult to access. This has made it difficult and expensive to conduct deep sea research and exploration. While the entire ocean floor has been mapped [1], only a small percentage has been explored in detail, and much of what lies beneath the ocean's surface remains a mystery.

query: the two most basic types of light in a scene are the key and the rim
response: Three-point lighting is a standard method used in visual media such as theatre, video, film, still photography, computer-generated imagery, and 3D computer graphics. It involves three separate positions of light, one key light shining directly upon the subject, one fill light shining from a side angle relative to the key, and one backlight shining on the subject from behind.[1][2]The key light to fill light ratio is usually 2:1, and the relationship of intensity and placement can change depending on the goals.[1]Therefore, the two most basic types of light in a scene are the key and the rim.

citation_annotations.citation_supports: Citation Completely Supports but Also Refutes Statement

citation_annotations.evidence: The key light, as the name suggests, shines directly upon the subject and serves as its principal illuminator The fill light also shines on the subject, but from a side angle relative to the key and is often placed at a lower position than the key (about at the level of the subject's face). The backlight (a.k.a. the rim, hair, or shoulder light) shines on the subject from behind, often (but not necessarily) to one side or the other.

Generally, the key light to fill light ratio is 2:1. The relationship of intensity and placement can change depending on your goals, but the above ratio will give you a relatively cinematic look for narrative filmmaking and even some YouTube videos.

query: what is the longest made field goal in nfl history
response: Justin Tucker holds the record for the longest field goal in NFL history, having kicked a 66-yarder in 2021.[1][2]Matt Prater had previously held the record with a 64-yarder in 2013[3], while Tom Dempsey and Jason Elam had both kicked 63-yarders in 1970 and 1998 respectively.[3]The longest field goal attempt in NFL history is held by Sebastian Janikowski at 76 yards[1], while the longest field goal attempt in college football history is 69 yards, set by Abilene Christian's Ove Johansson in 1976.[1]

Tucker’s kick broke the previous record that was set back in 2013. Cardinals kicker Matt Prater was the previous record holder with a kick of 64 yards against the Tennessee Titans. query: how are pitchers voted into the all star game
response: Pitchers are voted into the All-Star Game by a combination of fan ballot, player ballot, and the Commissioner's Office. Fans vote for eight starters in the NL and nine in the AL, including one catcher, one player at each infield position, three outfielders, and in the case of the AL, a designated hitter. Major league players vote for eight position players in each league, plus the designated hitter for the AL, as well as five starting pitchers and three relievers. The Commissioner's Office is responsible for finishing out the roster, selecting eight players in the NL and six in the AL.[1][2][3]
